cooperate
B2 to act or work together for a particular purpose, or to be helpful by doing what someone asks you to do: A two-year old is likely to refuse to cooperate when you tell her to get dressed. The two companies have cooperated in joint ventures for the past several years. The Spanish authorities cooperated with the British police in finding the terrorists. Synonym
